alert.note: Alert for Mainland Dare; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 15 at 2:17PM EST until December 18 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...2 to 4 feet inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the Albemarle, Croatan, and Pamlico Sounds, Alligator River, and adjacent tidal creeks, and areas along the Bay and lower Neuse River and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
